name: Opinions on lvl 30 Bard build intended for DnD Hardcore rules, solo (Swordflight module)
author: Luj1

posts.author: Luj1
posts.content:
Okay so I'm not as proficient as you guys in building so forgive me for not coming up with a detailed plan. But this is what I had in mind.


Human
Male
Smite-proof alignment (prolly Chaotic Neutral)

2 Barbarian / 16 Bard / 12 Pale Master

Why 2 levels of Barbarian? Uncanny Dodge, Rage 1x day, proficiencies
Why Pale Master? Short answer - tankiness. Immunity to crits, lots of AC, HP
Why Bard? Good self-buffing from start to finish. Level 16 Song, Curse Song, Haste, Improved Invisibility, Keen, War Cry. Also class has solid saving throws

Str - 16 till max
Dex - 8
Con - 12
Int - 14 (for some feats like Imp. Knockdown and to take many skills)
Wis - 8
Cha - 16

Pre-Epic Feats (8 total) - Luck of Heroes + Strong soul at first lvl (good saves), then Toughness (for HP), Still Spell, Curse Song, Knockdown, Improved Knockdown, Combat Casting

Epic feats - Armor Skin (to stack AC to high levels), Epic Prowess (to make up for lost BAB), Automatic Still Spell (eventually)... dunno what else to pursue

Skills - Perform, Tumble (in 5pt increments for the hidden AC bonus), Spellcraft (in 5pt increments for the hidden spell resistance), Use Magic Device, Discipline... want to get Persuasion too
Basically my intention was getting Imp. Invis + Haste + Keen  on a mid-BAB class . Then Pale Master for more defense (I thought about RDD but that is more offensive).

I opted for STR and not DEX cause this character will be defensively strong (I think) , but will maybe lack some damage 

I'd like to hear opinions on how to improve this build and finalize it 

Also I had some questions:

1. Do I really need Uncanny Dodge (which is why Im taking 2 levels of Barb)? I am not a dex fighter and Uncanny dodge doesnt help with retaining Dodge AC and Tumble bonuses right? Is there no way to retain those?

2. Generally I am a little clueless which pre-epic feats to take. Do I need any of these: Combat Casting, Expertise, Improved Initiative, Blind fight? And do I need concentration skill?


PS In case you were wondering Swordflight is a module balanced for D&D Hardcore Rules and implements severe rest restrictions

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Ten levels of RDD does give +4 AC, so it is not purely offense, and you get better BAB than Pale Master. If you make a Bard 16 / Barbarian 4 / RDD 10, and if you follow the rule of 4, you will get your 4th attack.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I'm in no way qualified to comment on PM builds, but I totally get what Empyre says about RDD (assuming you only want PM for the AC bonus).

As to your questions: you don't lose your Tumble bonus, no matter what it always adds to your AC. And yes, Blind Fight is almost obligatory. You're also lacking in a Weapon Focus (and EWF), which may be a character choice, but if you're going Strength might be questioned. I'm not sure whether you want a primarily spell-chucker or melee type here. If melee, I'd drop Charisma down (and maybe some levels of Bard) and boost other areas - relying on the Song(s) for buffs and penalties. If not, drop Strength if you don't intend to be up front and personal.

My understanding is that Swordflight is particularly favoured to melee builds - especially at early levels - if that helps at all. Might be worth a think.

Cheers!

posts.author: Luj1
posts.content: In the end I decided to go with 12 Bard / 10 RDD / 10 Pale Master

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
From my understanding, based on some reviews from Lilura & from the Vault,
with such a build you run the risk of making this a battle of the '20s. The main enemies in Swordflight have a competent AC unlike what you are used seeing in other modules.
Optimally, you also need a build that is optimized for level 26-27 and not 30, as this is what you end up in the third module.
In my opinion, you should seek a build that is either Fighter-Bard-Palemaster OR Fighter-Bard-RDD, with a shield of course.
The other option is a Fighter-Rogue-Weapon Master & dispatch them before they become a nuisance.
Have fun.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Why don't you post your build/draft so we can comment on it and help you improve it?

From what you have posted so far: I would take Armor proficiency heavy, and a weapon focus + epic weapon focus. I would drop combat casting. Still spell, and the saves feats are nice to have, but not a "must" with this kind of build. With a starting dex of 8, you don't need uncanny dodge. You have choosen some essential skills. Taunt is also a fine combat skill.
I agree with taking RDD. If you take PM, you must find a way to secure a high enough AB.

Edit: For Auto still one needs the ability to cast level 9 spells. Bards only get level 6 spells.
